column1: 4.4.4	  Summary of evidence and recommendations for the evaluation and management of urethral   trauma
A concomitant urethral injury complicates penile fractures and requires specialised management.

Ultrasound can determine intra- and/or extra-testicular haematoma, testicular contusion, or rupture   with heterogeneous echo pattern parenchyma and loss of contour definition a highly sensitive and   specific finding.
Surgical treatment of penile fracture ensures the lowest rate of negative long-term sequelae on   functional and psychological wellbeing of the patient.
In patients with testicular rupture or equivocal imaging, surgical exploration can secure preservation of   viable tissue.
